result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiara L Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Pay all costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by 09/01/16 or civil judgment.The court will waive all costs, fees and surcharges that it is able due to inability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiara L Malone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and the defense.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Corrections with 3 days credit for time served. This is a time served disposition.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 09/01/2016 or the result is a civil judgment.  The Court will waive all court costs, fees, and surcharges that it is able to due to an inability to pay.

Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Pre-trial incarceration credit

Defendant Tiara L Malone in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial however, parties have reached a resolution.

Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court vacated the jury trial date of 09/16/2015.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tiara L Malone in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties request an adjourned Final Pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tiara L Malone in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for  plea and sentencing.  Defense requests to set case for final pretrial and jury trial.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tiara L Malone in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests one final adjournment to go over new offer with defendant. Court will allow the adjournment.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. This is to be the FINAL adjournment.  jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tiara L Malone in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case held off the record.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tiara L Malone in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Tiara L Malone in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
